author: Harriet Torry
title: Treasury: Federal Budget Surplus for April Largest on Record, Driven by Tax Deposits
text:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. government posted the highest surplus on record in April, although the federal deficit widened as spending rose along with revenues.
Government revenue rose by 12%, or $55 billion, in April from the same period a year earlier, the Treasury Department said Thursday. That brought April’s surplus to $214.3 billion, the largest April surplus on record.
More...
